content: What is the name of the 16th-century Italian artist known for his work in the High Renaissance, including the School of Athens?

I believe you're referring to Raphael, an eminent Italian painter and architect of the High Renaissance period. He is renowned for his frescoes in the Vatican Palace, particularly "The School of Athens," which is one of his most celebrated works. Raphael's ability to capture idealized beauty, harmony, and balance in his compositions has made him a pivotal figure in the history of art.
